intro: Raillardella argentea, commonly known as silverleaf raillardella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, silvery-gray leaves that are covered in fine, fuzzy hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow to orange in color and bloom in late spring to early summer. Raillardella argentea is often found in rocky soils and arid environments, making it well adapted to dry conditions.
